reviewText:
One of gaming's rarest phenomenon. CS: Source (and it's predecessors) somehow found the balance between competitive and fun. The downright silly and super serious. Technical and instinctual.
The ability to allow your players to expand upon the original game almost limitlessly. Customization and depth is everywhere. From maps, models, skins, admin commands, sprays, communication, server types, etc. The commands, binds, scripts even the hacks can all be impressive.

Servers have been around for years and some since the beginning. Servers you can call your second home, a place where everyone knows your name. A great game to meet new people and find friends.

You'll actually improve you K/D ratio depending on how drunk you are (Drunken Boxing/Zui Quan martial art equivalent).

How developers should treat the players. Give them the game and development tools. Something to start with as they explore to their imaginations limits.

The type of game you wish others followed in it's example.

One of the last great games made by Valve before they began to go downhill... Unpopular Opinion I know, but the company has been all over the place developing and experimenting in things that aren't what made them so great in the first place. Dota 2's Arcade is an exception to this; a step in the right direction that reminded me of the old days.

Overall this game is still alive and a home to many still to this day. A refuge from the experimental project known as CS: Globally Offensive.

Ok, here are your options. You can buy this package and get three multiplayer games. Or you can buy the retail version of Half Life 2 and get Counter Strike:Source, Half Life 2 Deathmatch, and the story version of HL2. Basically, with this package versus HL2 retail, you will be trading the story version of HL2 for the multiplayer game Day of Defeat and whatever price difference there is.

Now with that out of the way, I'd assume you are looking at this page because you are interested in Counter Strike: Source. Good choice. There is a reason CS:S is the number one online game in the world. The game is amazing......it's that simple.

The game is set up around the premise of Terrorists vs. Counter-Terrorists. When you first join a server you choose which side you want to be on, the main difference being the weapons you will have access to. During the game each team has a different goal. One some levels the Terrorists have to plant a bomb while the Counter-Terrorists try to stop them. On other levels the Counter-Terrorists try to rescue some hostages while the Terrorists try to stop them. During each round you get 1 life. That's it! This means if you die you have to sit around and wait until the round is over. It's not a big deal though, the levels are generally small and well designed, and rounds don't usually last very long. Some of the positives of this system are that it discourages Rambo" type play where people will just run around with guns blazing

You'll definitely don't want to miss this one. I recommend this.

reviewText:
What is Counter Strike: Source?
It is a multiplayer first-person shooter which is a remake of the original Counter Strike that focuses on the teams of Counter-Terrorists against Terrorists, this game includes plenty of maps including some well known maps such as de_dust2 with the gamemode of Bomb defusal and cs_office having the gamemode of Hostage rescue.This game involves quite a bit of skill unlike other first-person shooters out there which can be hard to get used to.

How it Works
This game takes quite a bit of skill as said previously, it requires knowledge and understanding of the game. This can mean learning the economics of the game, from nade usage to shooting and compnesating spray control. As you progress you will start to learn these things. Learning is what makes this game longer-lasting and more enjoyable than other first-person shooters.

Popular Gamemodes
Bomb Defusal
This is a gamemode with the main objective where the Counter-Terrorists try to prevent the Terrorists from planting at either Bomb sites A or B. There are 2 ways that will give you victory, as Counter-Terrorists you can eliminate the enemy team or defuse the bomb before it explodes. When playing as Terrorist you can win doing the same thing as the Counter-Terrorists which is eliminating the enemy team or planting the bomb and letting it explode.

Hostage Rescue
A gamemode which has hostages that are placed where the Terrorist spawn, same concept with the wiping out enemy team but instead of the Terrorists objective to plant the bomb, it is the Counter-Terrorist to rescue the hostages and take them back to where the Counter-Terrorists spawn.

Custom Gamemodes
Lastly in Counter Strike: Source you will be seeing a lot of custom maps and servers which make up majority of the servers nowadays. These gamemodes go from minigames to bhop and surf with plenty of other custom gamemodes to chose from. Custom gamemodes are especially fun to play when you are bored or just looking for something to play with your mates.


Conclusion
Well worth buying it if it goes on sale a little bit cheaper as it is a little old and not worth the $20 at the moment. Worth all the 200+ hours on this game however there aren't as much servers as they use to be because it is getting old and there are mods that are available which are a load of fun to play such as Jailbreak and Zombies. Hands down the best game for its time and maybe even today (at least for me). I do recommend this game to those who are thinking of purchasing it although you better purchase it soon as servers are getting wiped. Although if you are still wanting the Counter Strike Experience you can switch over to CS:GO (Counter Strike: Global Offensive). Its a good alternative but I still prefer Counter Strike: Source over it

9.5/10

reviewText:
Hitman Squads, is a crime business game with RPG elements, developed by Infinity Ward and published by EA. It took over 5 years to make, so you know it's good. You play as your custom hitman in a hitman squad. By the way, the game rips of Saints Row: The Menace of Shrek with it's crazy character customization. Anyway, you and your hitman squad to various crimes while trying not to be killed by the police with Sam Fisher nightvision goggles. You'll be doing things like planting bombs in a nuclear plant, holding hostages in an office while holding off the police, and doing a neighborhood heist. The game has an economy system that rips off Payday 2 that lets you buy weapons before going in. For example, you start out with a pistol. By completing missions, you get money. You can spend that money on new weapons and equip- WHY AM I TELLING YOU THIS. Just pay $35 in real life and get the raygun already.

The game isn't without it's flaws though. Everytime I beat the mission, I get sent back from the start and I have to do it 12 times in order to progress. Other than that though, the campaign is one of the best I've played. The game is also very unrealistic. The game doesn't let you aim down sights, and when you press Shift to sprint, you WALK instead? What were they thinking? The multiplayer is one of the worst I have ever seen. It's basically the same thing as the single-player, but you get to play as the cops, and you have to buy guns during matches. WHAT WERE THEY THINKING. Why would you play as the cops? That's stupid. Also, the MP9 Silenced SMG is overpowered. YOU CAN STAY OFF THE MINI-MAP. WHAT?

Even with all of it's flaws, it's still one of the best games I've ever played, if not the best. This game gets a 9001/10, get Call of Duty Ghosts 43 instead.

reviewText:
Fun, and with very fast-paced gameplay. Enjoyable regardless of how much time a day you have to play it. Graphics are very flexible (they can go from looking very realistic to looking like Quake), and overall the game is simply entertaining, it gives you good times. The only things that really annoy me are the default animations for each weapon, which look pretty...rough, as if they were taken straight from 1.6 without any editing (e.g smoothing the animations).

However the game does make up for it with the fact that it's very easy to mod. Once you put in it custom skins or maps of your liking, you're golden! It can give you an even better experience. CS:S is not just a realistic FPS; it can be everything, and you are the one who decides what the game should become with all the kind of mods that exist for it. For example, I'm even using a mod that turns all of the grenades into Rubik's cubes!

I recommend it.

reviewText: Counter-Strike: Source is, once you've gained a knack for it, the most consistently rewarding and surprising team-based shoot-'em-up available on the PC.A technically and graphically stunning port of a game that was already pretty damn good, with the potential to deliver bigger and better things in future. And you can’t complain too much about that.It's fast-paced and a little goofy, but it's also very tactical and teamwork based. The learning curve is very steep (the maps are easy to learn, but the shooting system is hard to perfect). The Source engine gives the game a solid feel. And if playing the standard way is not your things, there is a wide variety of custom maps and game types (minigames, zombie mod, jail break, hide n seek, surfing, etc...). Also if you think Call of Duty is competitive don't even bother buying this game. This is for the die hard FPS fans.It will take a long time to hone your skills. This game is timeless and one of the most intense shooters ever released.

reviewText:
Counter-Strike: Source is a improved version of CS 1.6 built on the source engine. Even though the game is 10 years old, it's still one of the most popular games played on Steam. The graphics may be dated compared to today, but the gameplay makes up for it. The thrill of just one more round, or when your entire team is dead and you try to clutch, and the huge sigh of relief when you defuse a bomb when it was 0.5 seconds away from exploding. AWPs, Deagles, M4s, AKs, and P90s. If don't like any of these waepons, you can always download skins from Gamebanana to replace the weapons you think are ugly. The game does have hackers and mic abusers but most of the servers I play on are troll free.

Pros
-Competitive
-Very Addictive
-Custom gamemodes (Gun Game, Surf, Deathmatch, Jump, etc.)
-Balenced
-Cheap compared to other MP shooters.(COD, BF)
-Very Active Community.

Cons
-Expensive compared to other CS games. (CS:GO: $15:00 USD)
-Dated graphics
-hackers
-Some weapons are op. (AWP,P90)
-Some maps are biased to one side.

Overall CSS is an extremely addictive shooter with a competitive taste. I give this game a 9.46/10

When I saw that Source was available with Garry's Mod for all but a shilling, I had to grab it and give it a test run. Safe to say, I haven't been disappointed.

With a complete graphical overhaul, I was paying close attention to the detail of the weapons and smaller geometries around the world in addition to the character texturing/meshes. » Graphical overhaul has mentioned, a real step-up from Condition Zero.

» Although this is a Valve product, it has great integration with Garry's Mod which is nice to see.

Cons:
» Considering this game is ten years old (I can't believe it!) it's absolutely magnificent. I just wish there had been a campaign like CZ.

My rating for CSS is 8/10. I took into account the length the game has been released and some of the technical factors in regards to the game engine and blockages that may have come up. The only thing that stopped it reaching a nine was the no campaign. I wish they had that!

reviewText:
The Counter-Strike series[en.wikipedia.org] has always been a childhood game right from the day I first endured my experience on the PC. Counter-Strike: Condition Zero was the first one I ever played, the campaign remains in my mind today even though I no longer have it (I think?). When I saw that Source was available with Garry's Mod for all but a shilling, I had to grab it and give it a test run. Safe to say, I haven't been disappointed.

With a complete graphical overhaul, I was paying close attention to the detail of the weapons and smaller geometries around the world in addition to the character texturing/meshes. Valve pulled it off, and they did it well. I played this game for hours with a friend, jumping from server to server experiencing what I had never done before. Playing online at such a young age during Condition Zero was just something I never did. In my own personal opinion, Source is better than even the more modern day Call of Duty's, and it is from the same category (First-Person Shooter). I even think the sounds got some looking after as they seem to be much clearer then they did back in 2004. However, all good things must come to an end as I stopped my CS experience here: Global Offensive just does not appeal to me, at all. Onto the pros and cons!

Pros:
» Graphical overhaul has mentioned, a real step-up from Condition Zero.
» Sound also seems to be a big factor. I noticed that even the running sounds were revamped for the release.
» Animations were reworked as far as I can tell. One thing that stood out to me was the idle animation for the knife.
» Many online gamemods, great fun to play!
» Although this is a Valve product, it has great integration with Garry's Mod which is nice to see.

Cons:
» Considering this game is ten years old (I can't believe it!) it's absolutely magnificent. I just wish there had been a campaign like CZ.

My rating for CSS is 8/10. I took into account the length the game has been released and some of the technical factors in regards to the game engine and blockages that may have come up. The only thing that stopped it reaching a nine was the no campaign. I wish they had that!
